decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck is focused on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer while disrupting the opponent with spells like Lightning Bolt and Mana Leak. By utilizing card draw with Gitaxian Probe and Treasure Cruise, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes some control elements such as Remand and Spell Snare to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful land acceleration provided by cards like Azusa, Summer Bloom, and Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and assemble the combo pieces needed to tutor up win conditions like Hive Mind. The inclusion of Pact spells allows for protection and additional flexibility in searching for key cards. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with efficient land ramping and explosive plays.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Borborygmos Enraged, then using Goryo's Vengeance or Unburial Rites to reanimate them for a game-winning combo. Necrotic Ooze can also be used as a versatile threat, while Zombie Infestation provides a steady stream of tokens to fuel the strategy. The deck also includes a mix of removal and card draw to help set up the combo and protect against disruption. Overall, the goal is to assemble the pieces needed to overwhelm the opponent with powerful reanimated creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly playing cheap spells and creatures to pressure the opponent's life total. By utilizing a combination of burn spells, cheap creatures, and card draw, the deck aims to put the opponent on the backfoot early on and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as counterspells and bounce spells to control the board and protect its own threats. The mana base is optimized for a mix of red, white, and blue mana sources to support the deck's aggressive gameplan.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a large number of artifact creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive attacks and powerful abilities. By utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Ensoul Artifact, the deck can power up its creatures and deal significant damage in a short amount of time. Additionally, the presence of cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager helps to further enhance the strength of the board state, making it difficult for opponents to effectively counteract the deck's aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently cast low-cost spells to trigger abilities that generate token creatures and burn the opponent's life total. By combining card draw, tempo plays, and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Young Pyromancer, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures. The flexible removal options and counterspells help to protect your board and disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing you to maintain pressure and close out the game swiftly.

The key concept of this UR Storm combo deck is to efficiently cast spells to trigger Pyromancer Ascension and reduce the cost of spells with Goblin Electromancer, allowing for explosive turns of casting multiple spells in a single turn to generate enough storm count for a lethal Grapeshot. The deck's main focus is on card selection, mana acceleration, and recursion, with Past in Flames allowing for a strong graveyard recursion strategy. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

The main concept of this Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing powerful multicolored creatures like Geist of Saint Traft, Tarmogoyf, and Siege Rhino alongside mana ramp from Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan. The inclusion of Tribal Flames adds a versatile finisher that can take advantage of the deck's diverse mana base to deal significant damage to the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of artifacts onto the battlefield, using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp into powerful threats like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager. Ensoul Artifact and Master of Etherium provide additional power and toughness boosts, while Etched Champion offers protection against targeted removal. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression while leveraging the synergy between artifacts to create an explosive and versatile playstyle.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells and removal spells while also having card advantage through cantrips and Snapcaster Mage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells and removing threats, while also being able to stabilize the board with cards like Batterskull and Vedalken Shackles. The inclusion of Blood Moon can also disrupt mana bases, giving the deck even more control over the game. The deck has a strong late game with cards like Cryptic Command and Dig Through Time to pull ahead and close out the game.

This deck is focused on playing aggressive red creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It includes efficient one-drop creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm. The deck aims to apply constant pressure to the opponent and finish them off before they can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from gaining life or casting spells freely.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while applying pressure with creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Lingering Souls. The deck also has tools for removal like Abrupt Decay and Path to Exile to deal with threats on the board. It aims to control the board while also having a strong aggressive game plan with powerful threats like Liliana of the Veil and Anafenza, the Foremost. Overall, this deck combines disruption, removal, and aggressive creatures to dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on putting constant pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption spells. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino. The combination of hand disruption, removal, and resilient threats makes it difficult for the opponent to stabilize, allowing the Aggro player to maintain the upper hand and close out the game quickly. The Abzan colors offer a versatile and adaptable game plan, ensuring the deck can handle a wide range of threats and strategies.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with efficient and powerful creatures like Siege Rhino, Tarmogoyf, and Scavenging Ooze, while disrupting their game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Path to Exile, and Liliana of the Veil to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's three-color strategy, allowing for consistent access to the different colors needed to cast its spells.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Young Pyromancer, while supporting them with efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Gitaxian Probe, and Treasure Cruise to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Mana Leak and Remand helps to protect the threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board with tempo plays and card advantage, while closing out the game quickly with a stream of creatures and burn spells.

The main focus of this UR storm deck is to quickly generate mana and cast a series of cheap spells to trigger Pyromancer Ascension. By copying spells and generating more mana, the deck aims to fill the graveyard with flashback spells like Past in Flames and finish off the opponent with Grapeshot. The deck relies on card draw, cantrips, and mana ramp to chain spells together and create a high storm count for maximum impact. It is a combo deck that requires careful sequencing and resource management to execute its game plan effectively.
